title: Saguaro National Park: Fire Updates
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Wildland Fire     Fire Updates                Fire Updates            Fire Information   Saguaro National Park 24-hr Fire Info Hotline (recorded message): (520) 733-5150    Saguaro National Park Fire Information on Inciweb   Saguaro National Park News Releases   Saguaro National Park Facebook Saguaro National Park Twitter Arizona Fire Information Arizona Fire Information @wildlandfireAZ Twitter List with #AZFire Updates Frequently Asked Questions Southwest Coordination Center Fire Information (Saguaro National Park = AZ-SAP) Maps Interactive Fire Map Maps & Wildland Fire Data in Google Earth National Fire Information NPS Fire and Aviation Facebook page NPS Fire and Aviation on Twitter National Fire News   National Fire Maps    Return to Saguaro National Park Fire Management           Smokey Bear says "Only YOU can prevent wildfires."   Wildfire Prevention Year-Round Park Regulations:    Campfires are permitted only in picnic areas where fire grates are provided. Fires must never be left unattended and must be completely extinguished upon departure.If it's too hot to touch, it's too hot to leave! Stir, drown, and repeat until cold.   If you smoke, please practice Leave No Trace principles by packing out cigarette butts.   Use and possession of fireworks if prohibited year-round.    Fire Restrictions Tips for Enjoying the Outdoors Safely During Fire Season One Less Spark Means One Less Wildfire             Wildfire Preparedness Firewise  Fire Adapted Communities
